agenda_priorities: TIER 1: Critical blocking items (FedRAMP, pricing, OEM letter)

status_definitions.not_requested: Have not yet requested from Movius
status_definitions.received: Received from Movius, ready to use
status_definitions.blocked: Movius unable to provide, need workaround

tier_definitions.tier_1_critical_blocking: Cannot submit proposal without these - absolute blockers
tier_definitions.tier_2_major_impact: Critical for winning, significant impact on technical score

dependencies.description: Signed partnership or teaming agreement establishing formal relationship between RPR Tech and Movius for this proposal
dependencies.notes: Essential to establish prime-subcontractor relationship. May be simple teaming letter or full subcontractor agreement
action_items: Confirm format needed (teaming letter vs full agreement)
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Signed teaming agreement or letter on Movius letterhead with authorized signatory, dated October 2025

dependencies.description: Detailed pricing for all Movius-provided CLINs: 0001 (licenses base), 0003 (licenses premium), 0005 (web portal), 0006 (OMS&E Tier 3), plus optional CLINs
dependencies.notes: CRITICAL: Pricing must result in RPR Tech performing >50% of contract value per VAAR 852.219-75. If Movius pricing too high, may need to renegotiate or adjust RPR Tech scope
action_items: Verify pricing includes all costs (no hidden fees)
Calculate work split immediately upon receipt
pricing_clins: 0001: Messaging Platform License - Basic Tier (12 months)
0003: Messaging Platform License - Premium Tier (12 months)
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Complete CLIN pricing for base + 4 option years + 6-month extension, broken down by license, infrastructure, support

dependencies.description: Copy of current FedRAMP Moderate authorization certificate OR letter showing In-Process designation from FedRAMP PMO
dependencies.notes: PWS B.4.5.10 REQUIRES FedRAMP Moderate. If Movius lacks this, proposal is non-compliant and will be rejected. Q&A #18 confirmed this is mandatory
action_items: If authorized: obtain certificate copy with authorization date, 3PAO, package ID
If in-process: obtain letter from FedRAMP PMO with timeline
If neither: MAJOR PROBLEM - consider alternative platforms
dependencies.alternative_if_missing: Without FedRAMP, must pivot to different platform or withdraw proposal
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: ALL required FedRAMP artifacts received and verified as Moderate level
required_artifacts: FedRAMP Authorization to Operate (ATO) Letter - signed by authorizing official
System Security Plan (SSP) - full or executive summary
FedRAMP Marketplace listing URL and screenshot
Plan of Action & Milestones (POA&M) if applicable

dependencies.description: Signed letter on Movius official letterhead specifically authorizing RPR Tech to resell/provide Movius platform for RFP 36C10A25R0002
dependencies.notes: Required to demonstrate RPR Tech has authority to resell/implement Movius solution. Template provided to Movius. Must be on letterhead, signed by authorized rep, dated October 2025
action_items: Get executed letter scanned as PDF
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Letter on Movius letterhead explicitly authorizing RPR Tech to resell/provide Movius MultiLine platform for this RFP

dependencies.description: Access to FedRAMP SSP repository, recent 3PAO SAP report, and VA Implementation Diagram (VAID)
dependencies.notes: These are Day 5 and Day 10 contract deliverables, but showing access/awareness in proposal strengthens technical approach. Can reference availability rather than including full details
action_items: Request SSP repository URL or access confirmation
Request copy of most recent 3PAO SAP
Request sample VAID or confirm can be provided post-award
dependencies.workaround: Can state 'will be provided within X days post-award per PWS requirement' if not available for proposal
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Detailed response to all D.1 functionality items with specific Movius feature names and capabilities

dependencies.description: Clarification and additional detail for 4 critical gaps in D.1 functionality checklist responses
dependencies.notes: Movius provided D.1 CSV with 87/100 quality score. 4 items need additional detail. Responses need rewriting in RPR voice showing HOW, not just stating features
action_items: Review gaps with Movius: D.1.9 (templates), D.1.11 (audit logs), D.1.15 (encryption), D.1.20 (performance)
Get specific feature names, screen references, technical details
Rewrite all 22 responses in RPR voice with implementation approach

critical_gaps.needed: Confirm if platform supports custom signatures and automated message templates

critical_gaps.gap: No mention of retention period or search capabilities
critical_gaps.needed: Specify retention period, search interface, export capabilities
Encryption algorithms, key management, at-rest vs in-transit details

critical_gaps.gap: Generic response, no specific monitoring tools mentioned
critical_gaps.needed: What monitoring tools/dashboards exist? Real-time alerting?

dependencies.workaround: Can write technical approach based on standard platform capabilities if Movius unable to provide specifics, but weakens response
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Complete answers to all D.2 questions about service delivery model

dependencies.description: Answer to D.2 Question 7 about implementation timeline and phases - only missing item from D.2 questionnaire
dependencies.notes: Movius provided 7 of 8 D.2 answers. Q7 about implementation phases is critical for Volume I Section 6 alignment
action_items: Get Q7 answer from Movius during meeting
Align Movius implementation timeline with RPR 90-day plan
Ensure no conflicts between Movius approach and RPR approach
dependencies.workaround: Can write implementation section based on RPR Tech's approach and assume Movius will support, but prefer alignment
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: CRITICAL VALIDATION: Confirm Movius platform has TRUE in-app secure messaging, not just SMS relay. Q&A #44 confirmed VA does NOT want SMS-based solution
dependencies.notes: Q&A #44 response: 'It's not SMS, it's a secure messaging platform with in-app messaging'. MUST VERIFY Movius actually has this. If Movius is primarily SMS-based, we have wrong platform
action_items: Get explicit confirmation Movius has in-app messaging
Request screenshots/demo of in-app messaging interface
Confirm messages are NOT delivered via SMS
If Movius lacks this capability, MAJOR PIVOT REQUIRED
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: Explicit confirmation that Movius platform stores ZERO data on BYOD devices per Q&A #40 requirement
dependencies.notes: Q&A #40: 'The requirement is for true BYOD with no data stored on personal devices'. Need confirmation Movius architecture supports this
action_items: Get technical architecture diagram showing data flow
Confirm no message content cached on devices
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: Detailed information about Movius integration with Microsoft InTune MDM (VA's preferred MDM per Q&A #10)
dependencies.notes: Q&A #10: VA prefers InTune. Need to show how Movius integrates with InTune for device management, policy enforcement, remote wipe
dependencies.workaround: Can propose InTune integration as implementation task if not pre-built
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: Detailed architecture showing how Movius integrates with Microsoft EntraID (Azure AD) for authentication and authorization
dependencies.notes: Q&A #42: Integration possible in production environment only. Need details on SAML/OAuth2 setup, user provisioning, group sync
dependencies.workaround: Can describe standard EntraID integration patterns if Movius docs limited
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: High-level and detailed technical architecture diagrams showing platform components, data flows, security boundaries, AWS infrastructure
dependencies.notes: Helpful for Volume I Section 1 and for understanding platform for implementation planning
dependencies.workaround: Can create diagrams based on general knowledge of similar platforms if Movius unable to share detailed docs
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: Historical performance data, availability statistics, response time metrics to support RFP performance requirements (99.95% availability, 100ms response, 4hr TTR)
dependencies.notes: PWS requires 99.95% availability, 100ms response time, 4hr trouble ticket resolution. Need evidence Movius can meet these
action_items: Request uptime reports from past 12 months
dependencies.workaround: Can commit to metrics based on platform capabilities and RPR support structure even without historical data
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: 2-3 relevant government contracts where Movius provided messaging platform, for inclusion in Volume II Past Performance
dependencies.notes: Helpful to show Movius has government experience, but RPR Tech can submit with just own contracts if needed
action_items: Need: contract number, agency, period of performance, scope, POC contact info
Prefer federal contracts, but state/local acceptable
dependencies.workaround: Volume II can focus on RPR Tech contracts only
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: Sample training materials, user guides, admin documentation to inform Volume I training approach
dependencies.notes: Helpful to understand what Movius provides vs what RPR needs to create
dependencies.workaround: RPR can develop all training materials if needed
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

dependencies.description: API documentation for any custom integration or development work RPR might need to do
dependencies.notes: May be needed for custom integrations, but not critical for proposal
dependencies.workaround: Can state 'will leverage Movius APIs as needed' without specifics
dependencies.acceptance_criteria: Deliverable received, verified, and incorporated into proposal

questions: What format: teaming letter or full subcontractor agreement?
Who is authorized signatory at Movius?
Can we get this signed today/tomorrow?
What is total cost for all Movius CLINs?
Breakdown by: licenses, infrastructure, support, web portal?
Can pricing be adjusted if work split calculation shows RPR <50%?
Do you have FedRAMP Moderate authorization?
If yes: can we get certificate copy today?
If no: do you have In-Process designation? When will you be authorized?
If neither: this is proposal killer - need alternative platform
We sent template - can you execute on letterhead?
Who will sign?
Can we get signed PDF by tomorrow?
CRITICAL: Does Movius have TRUE in-app messaging (not SMS)?
Can you show us the in-app messaging interface?
How are messages delivered? (must NOT be SMS)
This is go/no-go for proposal
Does Movius store any data on BYOD devices?
Where are messages/contacts stored? (must be cloud-only)
Show us data flow diagram
D.1.9: Does platform support message templates and custom signatures?
D.1.11: What is audit log retention period? Search capabilities?
D.1.15: What encryption algorithms? Key management approach?
D.1.20: What performance monitoring tools/dashboards exist?
What is your standard implementation timeline?
Can you support our 90-day deployment plan?
What are implementation phases from your perspective?
Do you integrate with InTune?
If yes: how? API? What policies supported?
If no: can we build integration? Effort estimate?
Do you support SAML 2.0 or OAuth2 SSO?
User provisioning approach?
Group-based access control?
Can you share architecture diagrams?
Do you have performance/uptime reports?
Past government contract references?
Training materials samples?

scenario_1.condition: Movius has FedRAMP + pricing + OEM letter + in-app messaging confirmed

scenario_2.condition: Movius has FedRAMP + pricing + OEM letter BUT no true in-app messaging
scenario_2.decision: PIVOT to alternative platform OR WITHDRAW
actions: Evaluate alternative platforms (time may not allow)
Consider future opportunities if Movius obtains FedRAMP

scenario_4.condition: Movius pricing results in RPR Tech <50% work split
actions: Or increase RPR Tech scope (more services)

key_risks.mitigation: Verify immediately in meeting - no workaround available

key_risks.risk: Movius platform is primarily SMS-based, not true in-app messaging
key_risks.mitigation: Validate in meeting with demo - may need to pivot platforms

key_risks.risk: Movius pricing too high, results in RPR <50% work split
key_risks.mitigation: Negotiate pricing or increase RPR scope

key_risks.risk: Movius unable to provide OEM letter in time
key_risks.mitigation: Expedite signature process, escalate to Movius leadership

key_risks.risk: Movius gaps in D.1/D.2 responses weaken proposal
key_risks.mitigation: RPR Tech can fill gaps with technical approach and workarounds

version_history.changes: Initial skeleton created with comprehensive Movius dependency tracking
